intro: Koeleria fueguina, commonly known as the Falkland Islands grass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southern tip of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its fine, needle-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant thrives in coastal and arid environments, often found on rocky soils and sandy shores. Its adaptability to harsh climates makes it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat. Koeleria fueguina plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
